**Bad: Michael Jackson's Iconic Album**

Michael Jackson's album "Bad" came out in 1987, five years after his hit album "Thriller." It had a new, edgier sound and included hits like "Bad" and "Man in the Mirror." The album sold over 25 million copies worldwide, making it the best-selling album of 1987 and 1988. It won several awards and was nominated for Album of the Year at the Grammys. Jackson also went on a world tour, which was the highest-grossing solo tour of the 1980s. The album is still considered one of the greatest in pop music history.
